results.title: Curiosity show!: bag of tricks
results.brief_description: Entertaining and challenging compilation of simple experiments and science tricks from “The Curiosity Show”, many of which can be attempted in the classroom or at home. Written and presented by Rob Morrison and Deane Hutton.

results.title: Cummington story
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description: The story of the arrival in Cummington, USA, of a group of refugees from Europe and the manner in which they were accepted by the community. They are greeted by the minister of the local church, who has assumed the responsibility for their adjustment to a strange country, and has found a place for them to live. Then began the process of gradually breaking down the barriers between the new arrivals and the townspeople. Strangeness falls away, the minister implies, when people live and work and meet together. The story of this exercise in human relations is told with sympathy, understanding, and humour.

results.title: Cultured pearls
results.brief_description: The complete process of pearl culture. Women divers take oysters from the seabed, which are injected with tissue and kernels, and placed in wire baskets to mature in warm sea water in bays and inlets. A careful watch is kept on the temperature and conditions of the sea, and the oysters are moved in the water as necessary. The shells are cleaned once a year, until harvesting, when the pearls are removed, graded, inspected and made up for dealers.

results.title: Cultural stories
results.brief_description: There are 140 cultural groups living in Greater Dandenong, Victoria. To celebrate this cultural diversity this short documentary film presents Maria (Hungarian), Andreas (Greek Cypriot) and Rosanna (Chilean) as they each tell their personal story of their own background, family, culture and migrant experience to the sounds of traditional music and images of family photographs.

results.title: Cry of the marsh
results.creator_credit: Bill Snyder and Bill Snyder Films
results.brief_description: Marshes are the breeding grounds of millions of water-birds and untold numbers of interrelated wildlife. These precious wetlands are being drained, victims of man’s relentless search for more farmland and urban space. The film captures the poetic beauty of marsh life, then the terror and awesome finality which results when man reclaims a marsh for his purposes.

results.title: Crustacea from the gulf of Maine
results.brief_description: Balanus, Caprella, Crago, Hippolyte, Homarus, and Pagarus serve to illustrate various groups pf crustaceans found along the rocky coast of Maine. The picture opens with a colony of barnacles in action, followed by high magnifications of the cirri. Several specimens shed their integuments to allow for continual growth. Large individuals dredged from deep water are similarly shown. The skeleton shrimp shows its protective blending of form and colour with the algal background, and we see the peculiar structure of this obscure animal. The prawn and lobster reveal decapod structure and activity and demonstrate such features as the main divisions of the body, the mouth parts and the sensory and ecomotor appendages. The hermit crabs protect themselves by occupying the shells of various gastropod molluscs, and one individual deprived of its shell is seem to enter a new one in time to avoid capture of another hermit crab.

results.brief_description: Discusses the social, economic and religious climate that gave birth and then momentum to the Crusades and treats the various Crusades from a human viewpoint.

results.title: Cross your heart and hope to live
results.creator_credit: Bert Christensen and Danish Heart Foundation
results.brief_description: Looks at the rising incidence of heart disease in Western society. Of babies born with perfect arteries, by the age of 15 virtually everybody has ruined them to some extent. Points out that the “good life” is responsible - smoking, lack of physical activity, excess fatty substances in the blood, high blood pressure and overweight are to blame. Suggestions are made for overcoming the problem.

results.title: Cross country runner
results.creator_credit: Mark McCarty and Department of Theatre Arts, University of California
results.brief_description: A light-hearted allegorical spoof of modern society, depicting the trials and tribulations of a cross-country runner who takes time out from a race to visit friends and family. Cast includes David Aldrich.
